hours_text:
Blue Star Contemporary offers free admission to our exhibitions.

  * Located in Building C of the Blue Star Arts Complex
  * 116 Blue Star
  * San Antonio, TX 78204
  * 210.227.6960 (Phone)
  * [bsc@bluestarcontemporary.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20220807152104/mailto:bsc@bluestarcontemporary.org)

Blue Star Contemporary is the nonprofit contemporary art organization making its home since 1986 in the wider [Blue Star Arts Complex](http://web.archive.org/web/20220807152104/https://bluestarartscomplex.com/). If you are interested in leasing or First Friday vendor information, please contact the Blue Star Arts Complex directly at 210.354.3775.

Blue Star Contemporary has taken **Greater SAfer Together Pledge** out of care for our community and we are currently operating with the following visitor requirements and procedures in place:

  * Guests over the age of 10 years old **should wear face coverings and observe social distancing guidelines** while visiting the galleries.
  * BSC asks that guests who feel sick or have recently traveled refrain from visiting the space.

Masking and social distancing guidelines are subject to change without notice depending on community health levels and guidance of public health professionals.

## Gallery Hours

Visit our [exhibitions](http://web.archive.org/web/20220807152104/http://bluestarart.org/exhibitions) page for details regarding opening and closing dates of shows to avoid visiting during an installation period when the museum is...

About this capture

COLLECTED BY

Organization: [Archive Team](https://archive.org/details/archiveteam)

Formed in 2009, the Archive Team (not to be confused with the archive.org Archive-It Team) is a rogue archivist collective dedicated to saving copies of rapidly dying or deleted websites for the sake of history and digital heritage. The group is 100% composed of volunteers and interested parties, and has expanded into a large amount of related projects for saving online and digital history. 

History is littered with hundreds of conflicts over the future of a community, group, location or business that were "resolved" when one of the parties stepped ahead and destroyed what was there. With the original point of contention destroyed, the debates would fall to the wayside. Archive Team believes that by duplicated condemned data, the conversation and debate can continue, as well as the richness and insight gained by keeping the materials. Our project...
